resources.string: Resonators are deployed on a portal in order to capture it or upgrade existing resonators.

There's a limit of resonators of one level a player can deploy on one portal:
1x L8
1x L7
2x L6
2x L5
4x L4
4x L3
4x L2
8x L1
XMPs are weapons used to attack enemy portals. XMP\'s from different levels have different ranges of attack and higher potential damage.

They are easy to hack but easy to waste. If you want to lower the number of XMPs you need to take down a portal, make sure you are as close as possible to the portal and long press the Fire button to get up to 20% attack bonus.

Contrary to XMPs, Ultra Strikes do more damage but in a much tinier range. That\'s why they are used to destroy shields (by staying the nearest to the middle of a portal) or to destroy single resonators by staying on them as well.
Don\'t waste them, they are not that common in hacks. In order to get more out of an ultra strike, long press the fire button to get up to 20% attack bonus.

An ADA Refactor is a weapon used to instantly switch the colour of a green portal to blue. Once applied on a portal, mods and resonators stay the same, but the name and the faction of the portal changes and links are being destroyed.
Don\'t waste them. You don\'t get AP for destroying resonators, links or fields when using an ADA. Be aware that you can only use an ADA on a portal that\'s maximal one level above your own level.

A Jarvis Virus is a weapon used to instantly switch the colour of a blue portal to green. Once applied on a portal, mods and resonators stay the same, but the name and the faction of the portal changes and links are being destroyed.

Don\'t waste them. You don\'t get AP for destroying resonators, links or fields when using a Jarvis virus. Be aware that you can only use a Jarvis on a portal that\'s maximal one level above your own level.
Power Cubes are used to refill your XM bar, so you can continue playing without having to pick up XM from the ground.
XM gain is calculated by multiplying the level of the power cube by 1000.

Portal keys are the most important gain of a hack. With portal keys, you are able to link a portal to another portal if you\'re in the range of the start portal and if you have a key of the target portal. In addition, portal keys can be used to recharge portals when they\'re not in your range.
Once you\'ve hacked a key out of a portal, you won\'t be able to hack another one unless you drop the key or store it in a capsule of whatever type.

Shields are a portal\'s bodyguards. They decrease the damage an XMP or Ultra Strike can do on your portal. Two attributes define a shield\'s behavior: Mitigation and Stickiness. Mitigation is the shield\'s protecting ability. The stickiness describes the shield\'s lasting ability, so to say whether it lasts long or not long when under XMP attacks.
Not only shields add mitigation to a portal, but links do as well. Check out our Portal Simulator for further information.
The drop rate of AXA shields is slightly higher on AXA portals, which are present at all AXA agencies in some countries.
AXA shields are the best shields in Ingress. They have the highest mitigation and stickiness. As you might guess, they have been introduced in cooperation with the AXA assurance company.

Heatsinks are mods used to decrease the waiting time between 2 hacks on the same portal. The standard amount of waiting time is 5 minutes but with heat sinks you can decrease this time to even lower than 30 seconds! See our Portal Simulator for further information.
The effect a heat sink has on portal cooldown decreases with each additional heat sink. See our Portal Simulator for quick and precise calculation of the cooldown period.

A multihack is used to increase the maximum amount of hacks that can be done in 4 hours (after the first hack). A standard portal can be hacked up to 4 times. Take a look at our Portal Simulator to experiment with multihack-effects.
Portal burned out but you don\'t want to wait 4 hours to hack again? See if there is an empty mod slot and put in a multihack to reset the 4 hour period.
Force AMPs are mods used to give a portal the power to answer with more damage by attacking an enemy player when he hacks or attacks a portal. See our Portal Simulator to find out more.
The effect of Force AMPs decreases the more you deploy, take a look at our Portal Simulator.

Turrets are used to increase the frequency of a portal\'s attacks against enemy players, for both, XMP attacks or just hacks. For example a portal does not always shoot back when you hack or attack it, but with the turrets, you can change this probability.
The effect a turret has on the attack frequency decreases the more you deploy, use our Portal Simulator to calculate the attack frequency.
Link AMPs are mods used to increase the maximum link range of a portal.
Very rare link amps can only be received by redeeming a passcode. They are mostly distributed on anomalies or to players who have a big and completely planned operation, when they ask Niantic.
Softbank Ultra Link Amps have many features. They increase the link range of a portal, the limit of 8 outbound link by 8 per Softbank Ultra Link and they the mitigation from links by 50%.
Just as normal link amps, their effect decreases the more you deploy, use our Portal Simulator to calculate their effect on the portal.
You can store any item in capsules (except capsules…) but they won\'t free up space in your inventory.
Items in a capsule still count towards the 2000 item limit of your inventory. Be aware that keys stored in a capsule cannot be used to link or recharge portals.
MUFG capsules are awesome, period. They have made getting very rare items much easier, due to the fact that they duplicate items after a certain time that you\'ve them in.
Items in a MUFG capsule still count towards inventory item limit. In order to make items duplicate, the capsule must have some free slots and your inventory must as well have a few free slots.
Frackers are powerups which can be bought in the Store in Ingress. When used on a Portal, they double the hack output for 10 minutes or for 150 hacks, whatever comes first.

Best way to use them is when there are several rare or very rare heatsinks on the portal and when more than 1 or 2 players take advantage of it. Just like any other buyable item, they cannot be dropped or recycled.
Keylockers are similar to capsules. However, Keylockers can only store keys but they don\'t count towards the inventory item limit. They can be bought in the Ingress Store.
Just like any other buyable item, they cannot be dropped or recycled.
Beacons are simple markers on the scanner that hover over a portal. For some they are more a fun item than a utility item. They can be found in the store, under 4 different variations.
Just like any other buyable item, they cannot be dropped or recycled.

Badges aren\'t important as long as you plan to stay at level 8 or below. But once you want to reach levels above level 8, you will need a certain amount of badges to be able to reach those levels. Other than that, badges don\'t have any function other than bragging rights.
Items are a big part of the game.

The Abaddon Anomaly Badge was awarded only to people who made a contribution on the Abaddon Anomaly series, either as a field-agent or remote intel agent. In order to receive one of these, you had to register on the official Niantic Event.

You were able to get this badge when contributing to one of the following events: 

14th November 2015: 
Hamburg, Germany (P) 
Edinburgh, UK (S) 
Seville, Spain (S) 
Zagreb, Croatia (S) 

New Orleans, USA (P) 
Charlotte, USA (S) 
Guatemala City, Guatemala (S) 
Pittsburgh, USA (S) 

New Taipei City (P) 
Bangkok, Thailand (S) 
Manila, Philippines (S) 
Sydney, Australia (S) 

12th December 2015: 
Oakland, USA (P) 
Fort Worth, USA 
Lima, Peru (S) 
Phoenix, USA (S) 

Okinawa, Japan (P) 
Seoul, South Korea (S) 
Singapore, Singapore (S) 
Wellington, New Zealand (S) 

Milan, Italy (P) 
Gdansk, Poland (S) 
Porto, Portugal (S) 
Sofia, Bulgaria (S)

To get the Builder medal, you need to deploy or upgrade resonators

The different stages of the Builder medal:
Bronze: 2.000
Silver: 10.000
Gold: 30.000
Platinum: 100.000
Onyx: 200.000
To get the Connector medal, you need to establish portal links.

The different stages of the Connector medal:
Bronze: 50
Silver: 1.000
Gold: 5.000
Platinum: 25.000
Onyx: 100.000
To get the Engineer medal, you need to deploy mods.

The different stages of the Engineer medal:
Bronze: 150
Silver: 1.500
Gold: 5.000
Platinum: 20.000
Onyx: 50.000

To get the Explorer medal, you need to visit portals. By "visiting" is meant upgrading, either by deploying mods and resonators or by hacking (easiest method), but also by linking. Basically every action on a portal counts as a visit.

The different stages of the Engineer medal:
Bronze: 100
Silver: 1.000
Gold: 2.000
Platinum: 10.000
Onyx: 30.000
To get the Hacker medal, you need to hack portals.

The different stages of the Hacker medal:
Bronze: 2.000
Silver 10.000
Gold: 30.0000
Platinum: 100.000
Onyx: 200.000
To get the Illuminator medal, you need to capture MU by creating control fields.

The different stages of the Builder medal:
Bronze: 5.000
Silver: 50.000
Gold: 250.000
Platinum: 1.000.000
Onyx: 4.000.000
To get the Liberator medal, you need to simply capture portals.

The different stages of the Liberator medal:
Bronze: 100
Silver: 1.000
Gold: 5.000
Platinum: 15.000
Onyx: 40.000
To get the Mind Controller medal, you need make fields.

The different stages of the Mind Controller medal:
Bronze: 100
Silver: 500
Gold: 2.000
Platinum: 10.000
Onyx: 40.000
To get the Purifier medal, you need to destroy resonators with XMPs.

The different stages of the Purifier medal:
Bronze: 2.000
Silver: 10.000
Gold: 30.000
Platinum: 100.000
Onyx: 300.000
To get the Recharger medal, you need to recharge portals. This can be done by going into your inventory, selecting \"Portal keys\" and recharging any portal that isn\'t fully charged yet.

The different stages of the Recharger medal:
Bronze: 100.000
Silver: 1.000.000
Gold: 300.000
Platinum: 10.000.000
Onyx: 25.000.000
To get the Sojourner medal, you need to hack any portal in a period of 24 hours, for a given time.

The different stages of the Sojourner medal:
Bronze: 15
Silver: 30
Gold: 60
Platinum: 180
Onyx: 360

To get the Specops medal, you need to complete missions. Missions can be found in the "Missions"-tab in Ingress (pretty obvious) and are sorted by rating and distance of the mission-beginning portal to you.

The different stages of the Specops medal:
Bronze: 5
Silver: 25
Gold: 100
Platinum: 200
Onyx: 500

To get the Translator medal, you need to perform glyph hacks instead of normal hacks. Glyphs can done by pressing and holding the "Hack Portal" Button when in range of a portal. The game of glyphing is the following: You will be shown 1 to 5 patterns (depending on the portals level) which you have to remind. After the patterns being shown, you have to redo them. You can get up to 15 glyph points when succeeding in a level 8 portal glyph hack.

The different stages of the Translator medal:
Bronze: 200
Silver: 2.000
Gold: 6.000
Platinum: 20.000
Onyx: 50.000
To get the Trekker medal, you need to move around. A lot.

The different stages of the Trekker medal:
Bronze: 10
Silver: 100
Gold: 300
Platinum: 10.000
Onyx: 2.500
Ada is the name of a character in the storyline. You were able to get this badge at an event where Ada was present.
You are not able to receive this badge anymore, unless you have a valid passcode.

The EVE Medal is similar to the Recruiter medal. It was introduced in July 2014 and to get it, agents had to recruit at least 3 more agents in a timespan of 20 days. Another difference to the Recruiter badge: You\'ve only received the EVE badge when recruiting iPhone agents.
As mentioned previously, you are not able to get this badge anymore.

The Founder badge is one of the oldest, non-tiered badges. Players received this badge in recognition of their contribution during the early days of Ingress. To get this badge, agents had to be Level 5 or more at December 14th 2013.
You can not get this badge anymore. That\'s why the players who own it since the beginning of Ingress are very proud of it.
For this badge you had to meet Hank Johnson, although this fact is unconfirmed. You were able to meet him at the Shōnin anomaly in Hannover, Germany in March 28th 2015.
The Initio Badge was awarded only to people who bought a t-shirt during the Interitus Anomaly series.
You are not able to get this badge, unless you have a valid passcode.

The Innovator badge is the second Founder. It has been released on November 15th 2014, to every player with at least level 3. It rewards the players which have made a contribution during the first 2 years with a good looking medal.

The different stages of the Innovator medal are: 

Bronze: Level 3
Silver: Level 9
Gold: Level 11
Platinum: Level 13
Onyx (Black): Level 15

The Mission Day badge is earned by contributing to a specified amount of special missions on an official Mission Day. These missions are mostly done in a group of people. The Mission Day medal can be gained after every anomaly in will stay the same.

What is it all about those NL-1331 badges? Where do people get them from?\n This badge can only be acquired when being at the right time at the right spot. A special van of the NIA group may come to your town and hand them out.
Unfortunately we have no idea if this badge is still available. Sure that on ebay or other online markets you may buy them, but there is no information of another visit of the NIA van.
Stella Vyctory is a character in Ingress like Hank Johnson. This badge bas distributed at the Hanover anomaly (Shonin) to people who chose a line.
As many other badges, you can not get this badge anymore unless you find a valid passcode.

Susanna Moyer is the main investigative journalist. She appears in almost every Media reports and emails from Ingress. Since there is so much about her, see this link for more, detailed information: https://niantic.schlarp.com/investigation:characters:susanna_moyer
As many other badges, you can not get this badge anymore unless you find a valid passcode.
The Vanguard badge was awarded only to people who reached at least level 3 at the 1st December 2015. It is to reward people for playing Ingress in year 3.

The different stages of the Innovator medal are: 

Bronze: Level 3
Silver: Level 9
Gold: Level 13
Platinum: Level 15
Onyx (Black): Level 16

 As you may have recognised, this medal has higher ranks than its previous one, the Innovator.

When you reach level 2 you\'ll be asked to enter a verification code that will be sent to you via SMS to verify that you are, in fact, you. Once that\'s done you\'ll automatically get the \'Verified\' badge and your inventory space will be expanded from 200 to 2000 items.

You can use the Portal Simulator to simulate different portal configurations and get information like energy, link range… This feature is a premium feature. When you decide to unlock this feature, you\'ll also have every future premium feature that we\'ll release.
